body:
TLDR: This updates our macOS toolchain to use a newer version of Clang, cctools (including new [dependency on libtapi](https://github.com/tpoechtrager/cctools-port/tree/master#dependencies)), LD64, the macOS SDK and pulls in upstream changes from `libdmg-hftplus`.

So far I've been testing depends builds (`HOST=x86_64-apple-darwin16`) inside a Debian Buster [Docker container](https://github.com/fanquake/core-review/blob/master/docker/debian.dockerfile), and running the resultant `bitcoind` and `bitcoin-qt` binaries on a macOS `10.14` system. The `.dmg` generated by a `make deploy` also mounts correctly on the same macOS system.

#### Clang
Upgraded from `3.7.1` to [`6.0.1`](https://releases.llvm.org/6.0.1/docs/ReleaseNotes.html)

#### cctools
* cctools `877.8` -> [`912`](https://opensource.apple.com/tarballs/cctools/)
* LD64 `253.9` -> [`409.12`](https://opensource.apple.com/source/ld64/)
* TAPI [`1000.10.8`](https://opensource.apple.com/tarballs/tapi/)

See [tpoechtrager/cctools-port](https://github.com/tpoechtrager/cctools-port/) and [tpoechtrager/apple-libtapi](https://github.com/tpoechtrager/apple-libtapi/).

#### minimum supported macOS version
Bumped from `10.10` to `10.12`.

My current reasoning is:
* 10.10 has been unsupported since August 2017 (~2.5 years at `v0.19.0` release)
* 10.11 has been unsupported since August 2018  (~1.5 years at `v0.19.0` release)
* In general, macOS users seem to be consistent at upgrading to new releases.
* Qt 5.12 (LTS) only supports [macOS 10.12 and above](https://doc-snapshots.qt.io/qt5-5.12/supported-platforms.html). As long as we are supporting macOS < 10.12 we would not be able to bump Qt to 5.12 (LTS) in depends for the `0.19.0` release.

I'd like to hear some thoughts here. Is anyone running a macOS 10.11 system, using Bitcoin Core, and cant / wont upgrade?

#### macOS SDK
Upgraded from building against the macOS `10.11` SDK to the macOS `10.14` SDK.

#### libdmg-hfsplus
Corys PRs have been merged (https://github.com/planetbeing/libdmg-hfsplus/pull/7, https://github.com/planetbeing/libdmg-hfsplus/pull/8), and the author was active for a little while in 2017/18. I've pulled the upstream changes into https://github.com/fanquake/libdmg-hfsplus/tree/master%2Btheuni and applied one of Corys commits.

As a side note, I've started porting the `libdmg-hfsplus` functionality to a new [Rust library](https://github.com/fanquake/libdmg_rust), and would eventually like to use it in place of `libdmg-hfsplus` in future. This would also mean we could drop the dependency on `genisoimage`, as I'll be fixing the creation portion of the tool. See [here](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/build-osx.md#deterministic-macos-dmg-notes) for more info.

#### TODO & Followups:
- [ ] Make the `10.14` SDK available to Travis.
- [ ] Cleanup and add more info to individual commits.
- [ ] Check if we can start using `thread_local` on macOS.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/536590f358dc3d3e5821eba7f1009452ea93b205/configure.ac#L859
- [ ] Update SDK extraction documentation - Xcode 10.x is no longer a `dmg`, it's a `.wip`.
- [ ] If it's decided that 10.12 is an appropriate minimum supported version, look at Qt 5.12 in depends.

Fixes: #16052
Closes: #14797
title: WIP build: macOS toolchain update
